page.title: 11MY GRANDAD'S SCHOOL DAY (1)
page.content: My grandad's name is Alf Bemrose and in 1935 I was 13 years old. I got up at 7.30 and then I would go down for my breakfast. I would have force cerial, a slice of home cured bacon and some bread and home made butter . At 8.15 I had to feed the pet rabbit . At 8.40 I left home and biked 3 miles to school at Pode Hole. At 9.00 the bell would ring and we stood in lines and then went in. At 9.10 we would do scripture. At 9.30 we did sums and at 10.00 we had a botttle of milk which held 1/3 of a pint and then go outside to play a game of football. At 10.15 we went in again when we did football training until 12.00. We took sandwiches to eat. I had fat bacon sandwiches, home made cake and orange squash. After dinner we played until 1.00.
